meanings.definition: To support or hold up by placing something underneath or against.
meanings.sent1: She was propping the door open with a rock.
meanings.sent2: He propped the ladder against the wall before climbing up.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was propping up the table with its tail.
meanings.sent4: The old tree was propping up the sky with its branches.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed the students how propping the bookshelf prevented it from falling.

meanings.definition: To lean or rest something against a surface for support.
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker was propping his backpack against a tree.
meanings.sent2: She propped her feet up on the ottoman after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was propping acorns against the window.
meanings.sent4: The artist propped his canvas against the easel to paint.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was propping her chin on her hand while daydreaming.
